item.title: 智库称 2040 年日本将面临近百万外籍劳工短缺问题
item.description: 据一家国家支持的智库周四估计，随着人口减少，日本政府要想实现经济增长目标，到 2040 年将面临近 100 万外籍工人的短缺。【原文：Japan faces a shortage of almost one million foreign workers in 2040 if the government wants to achieve its economic growth goals as the population dwindles, an estimate from a state-backed think tank showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 为什么欧盟对航空公司的要求会使进一步的协议谈判陷入僵局？
item.description: 德国汉莎航空公司花了一年时间与欧盟委员会交涉，才获准收购意大利 ITA 航空公司 41% 的股份，而且是在接受了巨大让步之后。【原文：It took a year of wrangling with the European Commission for Germany's Lufthansa to gain approval to buy 41% of Italy's ITA Airways, and only after it accepted big concessions.】

item.title: 洞察：Raiffeisen 对俄罗斯的押注如何将其推向边缘
item.description: 在长达四个多月的时间里，美国特使向奥地利莱法森国际银行（Raiffeisen Bank International）发出了越来越严厉的警告，要求其取消一项交易，他们称该交易与俄罗斯最有权势的寡头之一有关联。5 月，华盛顿的忍耐终于爆发了。【原文：For more than four months, U.S. envoys delivered increasingly shrill warnings to Austria's Raiffeisen Bank International to scrap a deal they said had links to one of Russia's most powerful oligarchs. In May, Washington's patience snapped.】

item.title: 早间竞标：押注美国降息、英国政局动荡
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole.】

item.title: 中国比亚迪在泰国开设东南亚首家电动车工厂
item.description: 周四，中国比亚迪在泰国的首家电动汽车工厂开业，这是该汽车制造商在东南亚的首家工厂。【原文：China's BYD opened its first electric vehicle plant in Thailand on Thursday, the auto maker's first in Southeast Asia.】

item.title: 亚洲股市创 27 个月新高，美元因降息言论下滑
item.description: 周四，亚洲股市触及 27 个月高点，原因是较疲软的美国数据缩小了美国 9 月降息的可能性，从而提振了债券和大宗商品，同时拖累了美元。【原文：Asia stocks hit 27-month highs on Thursday as softer U.S. data narrowed the odds on a September rate cut there, boosting bonds and commodities while dragging on the dollar.】

item.title: 数据疲软后美元处于守势，日元难有喘息之机
item.description: 周四，在美国经济数据继续显示增长放缓后，美元走低，但这对日元的影响不大，日元被压在 38 年低点附近，使市场对政府干预保持警惕。【原文：The dollar was on the back foot on Thursday after U.S. economic data continued to point to slowing growth, although that gave little relief to the yen, which was pinned around a 38-year low that kept the market on alert for government intervention.】

item.title: 数据显示美国经济降温，油价下滑
item.description: 周四早盘，油价下跌，因为美国就业和商业活动数据弱于预期，有迹象表明世界头号石油消费国的经济可能正在降温。【原文：Oil prices fell in early trade on Thursday after U.S. employment and business activity data came in weaker than expected, in signs the economy may be cooling in the world's top oil consuming nation.】

item.title: 日经新闻》称，日产和本田考虑在软件和充电基础设施方面开展合作
item.description: 日经新闻》周四称，日本汽车制造商日产汽车和本田汽车正在考虑使用标准化的汽车软件，并在电动汽车充电方面开展合作，这些措施可能会降低它们的成本。【原文：Japanese automakers Nissan Motor and Honda Motor are considering using standardised automotive software and working together on electric vehicle charging, the Nikkei newspaper said on Thursday, steps that could reduce their costs.】

item.title: 消息人士称，KKR、Francisco Partners 竞相收购 Instructure
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周三表示，私募股权公司 KKR 和 Francisco Partners 正在竞相收购美国教育软件供应商 Instructure，该公司市值达 34 亿美元。【原文：Private equity firms KKR and Francisco Partners are competing to acquire Instructure , a U.S. education software provider with a market value of $3.4 billion, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮有望使三星第二季度利润增长 13 倍
item.description: 由于对人工智能技术的需求推动了存储芯片价格的反弹，预计三星电子第二季度利润将同比增长 13 倍。【原文：Samsung Electronics is expected to post a 13-fold increase in second-quarter profit from a year earlier as demand for artificial intelligence technology fuels a rebound in memory chip prices.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Arkhouse 和 Brigade Capital 将收购梅西百货的报价提高至 69 亿美元
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引知情人士的话报道，Arkhouse Management 和 Brigade Capital Management 已提高了收购梅西百货的出价，收购价约为 69 亿美元。【原文：Arkhouse Management and Brigade Capital Management have raised their bid to buy Macy's for about $6.9 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 加州电动汽车目标的反对者向美国最高法院提起诉讼
item.description: 加州为降低温室气体排放而雄心勃勃地提出了采用电动汽车的目标，反对者本周向美国最高法院提起诉讼，这是对加州应对气候变化运动的最新一击。【原文：Opponents of California's ambitious targets for electric car adoption to lower greenhouse gas emissions took their case to the U.S. Supreme Court this week, the latest salvo against the state's campaign to fight climate change.】

item.title: 麦肯锡胜诉，驳回杰伊-阿里克斯关于破产冲突的诉讼
item.description: 一名美国法官周三驳回了退休的扭亏专家杰伊-阿里克斯（Jay Alix）的诉讼，他指控麦肯锡咨询公司（McKinsey & Co）在申请破产法庭许可从事利润丰厚的企业重组工作时隐瞒了潜在的冲突。【原文：A U.S. judge on Wednesday dismissed retired turnaround specialist Jay Alix's lawsuit accusing the consulting firm McKinsey & Co of concealing potential conflicts when seeking bankruptcy court permission to perform lucrative work on corporate restructurings.】

item.title: 早间竞标：市场情绪明朗，流动性清淡
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 美国法官阻止拜登政府禁止工人签订非竞争协议
item.description: 德克萨斯州的一名联邦法官周三部分阻止了美国联邦贸易委员会的一项规定生效，该规定禁止工人签署不加入雇主竞争对手或开展竞争性业务的协议。【原文：A federal judge in Texas on Wednesday partially blocked a U.S. Federal Trade Commission rule from taking effect that would ban agreements commonly signed by workers not to join their employers' rivals or launch competing businesses.】

item.title: 爱立信将因收购 Vonage 计提 11 亿美元减值费用
item.description: 移动通信设备制造商爱立信周三表示，公司将在 2024 年第二季度记录一笔 114 亿瑞典克朗（约合 10.9 亿美元）的非现金减值费用，这笔费用与公司收购 Vonage 有关。【原文：Mobile telecoms equipment maker Ericsson said on Wednesday it will record a noncash impairment charge of 11.4 billion Swedish crowns ($1.09 billion) in the second quarter of 2024, related to its acquisition of Vonage.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，萨克斯店主将在亚马逊的帮助下收购尼曼-马库斯（Neiman Marcus
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引知情人士的话报道，在亚马逊的帮助下，萨克斯第五大道百货公司（Saks Fifth Avenue）的母公司以 26.5 亿美元的价格收购了竞争对手尼曼-马库斯百货公司（Neiman Marcus），并获得了新公司的少数股份。【原文：The parent of Saks Fifth Avenue sealed a $2.65 billion deal to buy rival Neiman Marcus with help from Amazon , taking a minority stake in the new company, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 对冲基金年中表现不尽如人意
item.description: 据消息来源和公开数据显示，对冲基金上半年的表现好坏参半，宏观基金 Caxton Associates 难以维持收益，而几只多策略和系统性基金则表现抢眼。【原文：Hedge funds delivered a mixed first-half performance, with macro fund Caxton Associates struggling to maintain gains while a couple of multi-strategy and systematic funds went gangbusters, according to sources and public data.】

item.title: 艾伯维因收购相关支出下调 2024 年利润预期
item.description: 艾伯维周三下调了2024年调整后利润预期，因为该制药商预计将产生9.37亿美元的收购相关费用。【原文：AbbVie on Wednesday lowered its 2024 adjusted profit forecast as the drugmaker expects to incur $937 million in acquisition-related expenses.】

item.title: 亚马逊将停用其商用安全机器人 Astro
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）周三表示，它已决定停产面向中小型企业的安全机器人 Astro for Business，并将重点转向家用机器人产品。【原文：Amazon.com said on Wednesday it has decided to discontinue its security robot, Astro for Business, for small- and medium-sized businesses as it shifts focus to household robotics products.】

item.title: 沃尔玛必须面对商店欺骗性定价的诉讼
item.description: 联邦上诉法院周三裁定，沃尔玛必须面对一项诉讼，该诉讼声称沃尔玛在收银台收取的价格经常高于商店货架上的价格，导致消费者每年损失数亿美元。【原文：Walmart must face a lawsuit claiming it often charges higher prices at the register than it posts on store shelves, costing consumers hundreds of millions of dollars a year, a federal appeals court ruled on Wednesday.】

item.title: 会议纪要显示，美联储官员在上次会议上认为物价压力正在下降
item.description: 根据 6 月 11-12 日举行的为期两天的会议记录，美联储官员在上次会议上承认美国经济似乎正在放缓，"物价压力正在减小"，但仍建议在承诺降息之前采取观望态度。【原文：Federal Reserve officials at their last meeting acknowledged the U.S. economy appeared to be slowing and that "price pressures were diminishing," but still counseled a wait-and-see approach before committing to interest rate cuts, according to minutes of the two-day session held on June 11-12.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Skydance Media 获得派拉蒙控制权的交易可能在本周末完成
item.description: 熟悉交易过程的消息人士称，Skydance Media 收购影院运营商 National Amusements 及其在派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）的控股权的交易可能在下周一敲定。【原文：Skydance Media's deal to acquire theater operator National Amusements, with its controlling interest in Paramount Global , could be finalized by Monday, sources familiar with the deal process said.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，KKR 将以 47.5 亿美元从贝恩资本手中收购 Varsity Brands
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周三表示，私募股权公司 KKR & Co 同意以约 47.5 亿美元（包括债务）的价格从收购公司贝恩资本（Bain Capital）手中收购美国运动服和学校年鉴制造商 Varsity Brands。【原文：Private equity firm KKR & Co agreed to acquire Varsity Brands, a U.S. maker of sports uniforms and school yearbooks, from buyout firm Bain Capital for about $4.75 billion, including debt, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国银行商业地产贷款最新暴跌后忧虑犹存
item.description: 美国一些地区性银行和中型银行继续面临商业房地产（CRE）行业高风险带来的挤压。【原文：Several U.S. regional and mid-sized banks continue to face the squeeze from high exposure to the commercial real estate (CRE) sector that has been roiled by higher-for-longer interest rates and empty office buildings.】

item.title: 微软以 1400 万美元就加州有关工人休假的调查达成和解
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp）周三表示，该公司已同意支付 1400 万美元，以了结加州一家机构关于该公司非法惩罚请病假或家庭护理假的员工的指控。【原文：Microsoft Corp has agreed to pay $14 million to settle a California agency's claims that it illegally penalized workers who took medical or family-care leave, the agency said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉反对派在美国法院就 Citgo 支持的债券争端中获得支持
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院周三撤销了一名法官的裁决，即债券持有人对委内瑞拉国营石油公司提出的与该公司在美国的炼油厂 Citgo 有关的有效索赔，并指示法官在评估索赔时适用委内瑞拉法律。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Wednesday set aside a judge's ruling that bondholders had valid claims against Venezuela's state-run oil company related to its U.S. refiner Citgo, and directed the judge to apply Venezuela law in assessing the claims.】

item.title: 道富取代瑞银成为瑞士政府基金托管银行
item.description: 瑞士当局周三表示，美国道富银行已获得授权，担任瑞士联邦政府数十亿美元补偿基金的托管银行，该基金之前由瑞银集团托管。【原文：U.S. bank State Street has won a mandate to act as custodian bank for a multibillion-dollar compensation fund of the Swiss federal government that was previously at UBS , authorities said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 汽车制造商回应欧盟对中国产电动汽车征收关税
item.description: 欧盟对中国产电动汽车征收额外关税的措施预计将于本周四生效，一些汽车制造商已决定采取反制措施。【原文：With the European Union's extra duties on Chinese-made electric vehicles expected to take effect on Thursday, some carmakers have decided on counter measures.】
